title: They Said Tech Cant Replace Farmers But Look at This Farm Now!

tasks.task: Performing traditional farming tasks like tilling, planting, and harvesting.
subtasks: Tilling hard soil using a plow or cultivator.
Planting seeds at the exact depth and spacing using a tractor with GPS guidance.
Harvesting crops manually or with machinery.

tasks.task: Managing water resources in agricultural fields.
subtasks: Installing and monitoring smart irrigation systems with soil sensors.
Using data from sensors to determine optimal watering times and amounts.
Operating drones equipped with high-resolution cameras to monitor crop health.
Applying targeted nutrients or pest control using drone spraying.

tasks.task: Utilizing GPS technology in farming operations.
subtasks: Guiding tractors along precise paths using GPS satellite signals.
Accessing farm monitoring apps on smartphones or tablets to manage resources and make informed decisions.

tasks.task: Adapting to technological advancements in agriculture.
subtasks: Invest in new technologies such as smart irrigation, drones, and GPS-guided equipment.
Consider the long-term benefits and sustainability of adopting these technologies despite initial costs.
